page.title: 20ORIGIN OF MT.ASH'S NAME
page.content:
The origin of Mountain Ash's name is due to the simple fact that a large rowan tree(mountain ash)was situated near a ford that crossed the River Cynon where the Mountain Ash Inn stands today.
It was the bride of a predecessor of the Lord Aberdare Family who held the leaf of a rowan tree in her hand and requested that the inn that was being built should take the name of the rowan or mountain ash.
It was called the Mountain Ash Inn and the hamlet which grew around it became a village and eventually a town and all were known as Mountain Ash. Some people preferred the Welsh names Y Gerddin or Aberpennar(meaning mouth of the Pennar Brook)but Mountain Ash is the name that has remained.
